title: reduce option in NLLLoss
body_html:
Current online documentation states that loss per batch element can be obtained by setting 'reduce=False' while calling NLLLoss

http://pytorch.org/docs/master/_modules/torch/nn/modules/loss.html

But when I am calling
loss = nn.NLLLoss(reduce=False)

It throws error :

TypeError: init() got an unexpected keyword argument 'reduce'

I pulled latest pytorch. Is this option implemented in the last release ?
body_text:
Current online documentation states that loss per batch element can be obtained by setting 'reduce=False' while calling NLLLoss
http://pytorch.org/docs/master/_modules/torch/nn/modules/loss.html
But when I am calling
loss  = nn.NLLLoss(reduce=False)
It throws error :
TypeError: init() got an unexpected keyword argument 'reduce'
I pulled latest pytorch. Is this option implemented in the last release ?
body:
Current online documentation states that loss per batch element can be obtained by setting 'reduce=False' while calling NLLLoss

http://pytorch.org/docs/master/_modules/torch/nn/modules/loss.html

But when I am calling 
loss  = nn.NLLLoss(reduce=False)

It throws error : 

TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'reduce'

I pulled latest pytorch. Is this option implemented in the last release ?
